item.description:
@Legend1 wrote:

Ok fix the 2 errors. Delete the 2 ints you just added because the compiler said that they are already added.

Next errors should be. Look for:

public void AttackMage(int index)

add:

client castOnPlayer = (client) server.playerHandler.players[playerIndex];

Under:

println_debug("playerIndex: "+playerIndex+" spellID: "+spellID);}

item.title: Barrage spells
item.dc:creator: @Legend1 -Legend-
item.description:
@Legend1 wrote:

Declaring something is the same thing as adding something. Just add it anywhere below [tt]public class client extends Player implements Runnable {[/tt]. And just look around the name of the method if it fits. You can fit the “void” between 2 others. The ints, ie [tt]public int[/tt] can be added ABOVE [tt]public boolean process()[/tt].

Read full topic

item.title: Barrage spells
item.dc:creator: @Legend1 -Legend-
item.description:
@Legend1 wrote:

Replace with this:

if(spellID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell) { if(playerLevel[6] >= 93) { if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==false)) { sendMessage("You do not have enough runes to cast this spell."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(565, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==true)) { startAnimation(1979); castOnPlayer.playerGfx(369,10); hitDiff = 5 + misc.random(35); castOnPlayer.entangle(); castOnPlayer.inCombat(); castOnPlayer.stayStill(); inCombat(); stayStill(); actionTimer = 10; castOnPlayer.sendMessage("You have been frozen!"); sendMessage("You freeze the enemy!"); deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4); deleteItem(565, getItemSlot(565), 2); deleteItem(554, getItemSlot(555), 6); teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; } } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 93) { sendMessage("You need a magic level of 94 to cast this spell."); } }

Declare these:

public void entangle() { EntangleDelay = 70; }

public void inCombat()
{
LogoutDelay = 10;
}

public void stayStill() { teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; }

Declare these…

public int EntangleDelay = 0;
public int LogoutDelay = 0;

Make sure you have this:

public void playerGfx(int id, int delay) {
mask100var1 = id;
mask100var2 = delay;
mask100update = true;
updateRequired = true;
}

If not, add it.

Read full topic

item.title: Barrage spells
item.dc:creator: @Legend1 -Legend-
item.description:
@Legend1 wrote:

Because there is nothing in the part of the statement that would actually do the spell.

                    if (spellID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell)
                    {
                        if (playerLevel[6] < 94) {
                            sendMessage("Your magic level is not high enough.");
                            sendMessage("You must atleast have a magic level of 94 to cast this spell.");

That says that if your magic level is under 94 that it will not cast it.

                        } else if (playerLevel[6] >= 94) {
                            startAnimation(1979);
                graphicstimer = 18;
                        }
                        if (graphicstimer > 0) {
                            sendMessage("Must wait "+graphicstimer+".");
                        }
                    }

This piece says that if you’re magic spell is or higher than 94 it does some poor timer and attempts an animation. You’re missing the entire barrage spell code that would actually make it work.

Read full topic

item.title: Barrage spells
item.dc:creator: @kyled123 kyled123
item.description:
@kyled123 wrote:

i am wondering why none of my barrage spells work, but all the other ancient magiks spells work, this is what my ice barrage looks like.

                if (spellID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell)
                {
                    if (playerLevel[6] < 94) {
                        sendMessage("Your magic level is not high enough.");
                        sendMessage("You must atleast have a magic level of 94 to cast this spell.");                                 
                    } else if (playerLevel[6] >= 94) {
                        startAnimation(1979);
			    graphicstimer = 18;
                    }
                    if (graphicstimer > 0) {
                        sendMessage("Must wait "+graphicstimer+".");
                    }
                }

if someone helps me make it work id be very happy.
